Description: Lighter than normal pink, whitish appearance
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Qi and/or Blood deficiency, Yang deficiency, Cold
Clinical_Significance: Insufficient qi-blood circulation, weak yang unable to bring color to tongue
Associated_Symptoms: Fatigue, cold limbs, pale face, shortness of breath, weak pulse
Treatment_Principle: Tonify qi and blood, warm yang

Description: Very pale, almost white appearance
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Severe Blood deficiency, Yang deficiency, severe Cold
Clinical_Significance: Critical deficiency of qi, blood, and yang; poor circulation
Associated_Symptoms: Severe fatigue, dizziness, palpitations, cold body, anemia
Treatment_Principle: Strongly tonify qi, blood, and yang

Description: Light pink to pale red, healthy appearance
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal, healthy state; balanced qi, blood, yin, yang
Clinical_Significance: Proper circulation, balanced internal environment

Treatment_Principle: Maintain balance, preventive care

Description: Redder than normal, bright red appearance

Treatment_Principle: Clear heat and/or nourish yin

Description: Dark, intense red color

Clinical_Significance: Severe internal heat penetrating to blood level or organs
Associated_Symptoms: High fever, severe thirst, delirium, bleeding, dark urine
Treatment_Principle: Strongly clear heat, cool blood, nourish yin

Description: Tip of tongue is redder than body
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Heart fire, emotional stress, anxiety
Clinical_Significance: Heat in heart channel, often from emotional disturbance
Associated_Symptoms: Palpitations, insomnia, anxiety, mouth ulcers, disturbed shen
Treatment_Principle: Clear heart fire, calm shen

Description: Lateral edges redder than center
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Liver fire or Liver qi stagnation with heat
Clinical_Significance: Heat in liver-gallbladder channel
Associated_Symptoms: Irritability, anger, headaches, red eyes, bitter taste, hypochondriac pain

Description: Purple or bluish-purple discoloration

Description: Purple with red undertones

Treatment_Principle: Invigorate blood, clear heat, remove stasis

Description: Dark purple with blue tinge

Associated_Symptoms: Cold pain, cold limbs, cyanosis, chest pain
Treatment_Principle: Warm yang, invigorate blood, remove cold stasis

Description: Bluish discoloration
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Extreme Cold, severe Yang deficiency, blood stasis with cold

Description: Light purple or lavender shade

Description: Light, transparent white coating, tongue body visible
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal healthy coating or mild exterior pattern
Clinical_Significance: Normal stomach qi present, or beginning of exterior invasion
Associated_Symptoms: May be asymptomatic or mild exterior symptoms
Treatment_Principle: Maintain balance or gently release exterior

Description: Dense white coating obscuring tongue body
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Dampness, Phlegm, Cold-Dampness, food stagnation
Clinical_Significance: Turbid pathogen accumulation, impaired spleen transformation
Associated_Symptoms: Heavy sensation, poor appetite, bloating, thick phlegm, lethargy
Treatment_Principle: Transform dampness, resolve phlegm, strengthen spleen

Description: Yellow colored coating
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Heat, Interior heat, Damp-heat
Clinical_Significance: Heat in interior, inflammation, or dampness transforming to heat
Associated_Symptoms: Fever, thirst, yellow discharge, bitter taste, irritability

Description: Light yellow, transparent coating

Clinical_Significance: Beginning heat condition or mild internal heat

Treatment_Principle: Gently clear heat

Description: Dense yellow coating
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Severe interior heat, Damp-heat, phlegm-heat
Clinical_Significance: Strong internal heat or dampness-heat accumulation
Associated_Symptoms: High fever, strong thirst, constipation, yellow phlegm, infections
Treatment_Principle: Strongly clear heat, drain damp-heat, resolve phlegm-heat

Description: Grey colored coating

Treatment_Principle: Clear extreme heat or warm interior and dry dampness depending on moisture

Description: Black or very dark coating
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Extreme heat consuming fluids (dry) or extreme Cold (wet)
Clinical_Significance: Critical condition, extreme pathology, life-threatening heat or cold
Associated_Symptoms: Severe illness, high fever with dehydration, or extreme cold with dampness
Treatment_Principle: Emergency treatment: strongly clear heat and nourish yin OR rescue yang and warm

Description: Yellow coating with greasy, sticky texture

Treatment_Principle: Nourish yin, generate fluids, tonify stomach

Description: Coating through which tongue body color is visible
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Exterior pattern, mild pathology, or normal
Clinical_Significance: Mild condition or healthy state, stomach qi present
Associated_Symptoms: Mild or no symptoms
Treatment_Principle: Depends on coating color and tongue body

Description: Dense coating obscuring tongue body color
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Interior pattern, dampness, phlegm, food stagnation, turbid pathogens
Clinical_Significance: Substantial pathology, impaired spleen transformation
Associated_Symptoms: Heavy sensation, poor digestion, phlegm, fullness
Treatment_Principle: Resolve dampness, transform phlegm, move food stagnation

Finding: Coating at Root (Gen Bu You Tai)

Finding: Coating in Center (Zhong Bu You Tai)

Clinical_Significance: Digestive issues, middle burner imbalance
Associated_Symptoms: Digestive complaints, bloating, poor appetite
Treatment_Principle: Harmonize spleen-stomach, regulate middle jiao

Description: Coating only on one side of tongue
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Half exterior-half interior, or channel obstruction on one side
Clinical_Significance: Pathogen not fully exterior or interior, or unilateral channel problem
Associated_Symptoms: One-sided symptoms, partial symptoms
Treatment_Principle: Harmonize shaoyang or treat affected channel

Description: Patchy coating with areas of no coating, map-like
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Stomach-Kidney yin deficiency, damaged stomach qi
Clinical_Significance: Depletion of yin and fluids with damaged digestive function
Associated_Symptoms: Poor appetite, dry mouth, night sweats, poor digestion
Treatment_Principle: Nourish yin, strengthen stomach qi

Description: Sticky, greasy texture that's difficult to scrape off

Clinical_Significance: Dampness accumulation, impaired spleen transformation

Treatment_Principle: Transform dampness, resolve phlegm, strengthen spleen

Description: Thick coating resembling cottage cheese or curdled milk

Treatment_Principle: Strongly transform dampness, dissolve phlegm, move stagnation

Description: Rough, dry, flaky coating

Clinical_Significance: Depletion of body fluids, dryness consuming yin
Associated_Symptoms: Dry mouth, thirst, dry skin, constipation, dry cough

Description: Slightly moist, normal moisture level
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal fluid metabolism, healthy if not excessive
Clinical_Significance: Proper fluid balance
Associated_Symptoms: Usually indicates health
Treatment_Principle: Maintain balance

Description: Excessive moisture, appears wet and slippery
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Excess dampness, impaired fluid transformation
Associated_Symptoms: Edema, loose stools, heavy sensation, copious thin discharge

Description: Thick, soft coating like tofu or mould

Clinical_Significance: Severe accumulation of turbid pathogen
Associated_Symptoms: Thick discharges, severe digestive issues, heavy body
Treatment_Principle: Transform turbid dampness, strengthen spleen

Description: Coating firmly attached to tongue, difficult to scrape off
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Pathogen strongly rooted, stomach qi still present
Clinical_Significance: True pathology present but body still has resistance
Associated_Symptoms: Varies with pattern
Treatment_Principle: Treat underlying pattern

Description: Coating easily scraped off, not firmly attached
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Deficient condition, stomach qi weak, false pathogen
Clinical_Significance: Apparent pathogen may be false appearance of deficiency
Associated_Symptoms: Often with deficiency symptoms despite coating
Treatment_Principle: Tonify deficiency, strengthen stomach qi

Description: Tongue fits comfortably in mouth, normal proportion
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Healthy state, balanced qi and fluids
Clinical_Significance: Normal
Associated_Symptoms: None specific
Treatment_Principle: Maintain balance

Description: Tongue appears puffy and enlarged, may have teeth marks on sides

Description: Tongue appears small, thin, or shrunken

Description: Tongue can extend beyond normal length
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Heart fire, Spleen heat
Clinical_Significance: Heat causing expansion and extension
Associated_Symptoms: Restlessness, insomnia, mouth sores, irritability
Treatment_Principle: Clear heart fire, drain spleen heat

Description: Indentations from teeth along sides of tongue
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Spleen Qi deficiency, Dampness, Yang deficiency
Clinical_Significance: Weak spleen unable to transform fluids, tongue swells against teeth
Associated_Symptoms: Fatigue, loose stools, edema, poor appetite, heavy limbs
Treatment_Principle: Tonify spleen qi, resolve dampness

Description: Cracks or fissures on tongue surface
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Yin deficiency, Blood deficiency, Heat damaging fluids, congenital
Clinical_Significance: Depletion of yin and fluids, or constitutional (if lifelong)
Associated_Symptoms: Dry mouth, night sweats, thirst, dry skin
Treatment_Principle: Nourish yin, generate fluids (if pathological)

Description: Single crack running down center of tongue

Clinical_Significance: Disconnect between heart and kidney, or normal variant if shallow
Associated_Symptoms: Insomnia, anxiety, palpitations, lower back weakness
Treatment_Principle: Connect heart and kidney, nourish yin if symptomatic

Description: Many small cracks across tongue surface
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Severe Yin-Fluid deficiency, chronic Heat
Clinical_Significance: Severe depletion of body fluids
Associated_Symptoms: Severe dryness, chronic disease, emaciation
Treatment_Principle: Strongly nourish yin and generate fluids

Description: Tongue enlarged at tip, narrower at root
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Heart involvement, yin deficiency with empty heat
Clinical_Significance: Heat and fluid deficiency affecting heart
Associated_Symptoms: Palpitations, anxiety, insomnia, heart issues
Treatment_Principle: Nourish heart yin, clear deficiency heat

Description: Tip of tongue comes to a point
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Heart fire rising, emotional agitation
Clinical_Significance: Heat and disturbance in heart/shen
Associated_Symptoms: Anxiety, agitation, insomnia, mouth ulcers
Treatment_Principle: Clear heart fire, calm shen

Description: Tongue deviates to one side when extended

Description: Tongue curves or curls abnormally
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Internal wind, tendon contraction, extreme heat or cold
Clinical_Significance: Severe pathology affecting tendons and channels
Associated_Symptoms: Seizures, spasms, severe illness
Treatment_Principle: Extinguish wind, nourish blood-yin, relax tendons

Description: Tongue appears smooth, soft, tender
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Yin-Qi deficiency, Fluid deficiency
Clinical_Significance: Depletion of qi and yin, sensitive and fragile state
Associated_Symptoms: Fatigue, tendency to illness, sensitivity
Treatment_Principle: Tonify qi and yin gently

Description: Tongue surface appears rough, papillae prominent
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Excess heat, Blood stasis, Fluid depletion
Clinical_Significance: Heat or stagnation creating rough texture
Associated_Symptoms: Dryness, heat signs, pain, stagnation symptoms
Treatment_Principle: Clear heat, invigorate blood, generate fluids

Description: Tongue limp, weak, hard to extend
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Severe Qi-Blood deficiency, Fluid depletion, extreme heat consuming fluids
Clinical_Significance: Extreme deficiency, lack of qi and fluids to support tongue
Associated_Symptoms: Severe weakness, dehydration, extreme fatigue
Treatment_Principle: Strongly tonify qi-blood, generate fluids

Description: Tongue stiff, difficult to move or protrude

Clinical_Significance: Serious obstruction or wind, stroke risk or present
Associated_Symptoms: Speech difficulty, stroke signs, high fever, seizures
Treatment_Principle: Extinguish wind, resolve phlegm, clear heat/warm cold

Description: Tongue trembles or quivers when extended
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Qi deficiency, Blood deficiency, internal Wind, fear/anxiety
Clinical_Significance: Deficiency unable to nourish tendons or internal wind stirring
Associated_Symptoms: Tremors, weakness, anxiety, fear, chronic deficiency
Treatment_Principle: Tonify qi-blood, calm liver wind, settle shen

Description: Raised red bumps or prominent papillae, strawberry-like
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Extreme Heat in nutritive or blood level
Clinical_Significance: Deep heat, often with toxins or severe inflammation
Associated_Symptoms: High fever, severe infection, toxic heat conditions
Treatment_Principle: Clear heat from nutritive/blood level, cool blood

Description: Dark or black spots on tongue

Associated_Symptoms: Severe pain, critical illness, circulatory crisis
Treatment_Principle: Invigorate blood strongly OR address temperature extreme urgently

Description: Purple or red-purple spots, often under tongue

Associated_Symptoms: Pain, masses, varicose veins, menstrual issues with clots

Description: Thin, pale purple veins under tongue, not prominent
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal circulation
Clinical_Significance: Healthy state
Associated_Symptoms: None

Description: Thick, dark purple, engorged veins under tongue

Associated_Symptoms: Chest pain, fixed pain, cardiovascular disease, varicose veins

Description: Completely smooth, shiny surface with no coating or papillae

Associated_Symptoms: Severe malnutrition, chronic illness, emaciation, dry mouth
Treatment_Principle: Strongly nourish yin, generate fluids, restore stomach qi

Description: Red tongue with prominent red papillae resembling strawberry

Associated_Symptoms: High fever, rash, severe infection, delirium

Description: Tongue has appropriate moisture, neither too dry nor too wet
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal fluid metabolism, healthy state
Clinical_Significance: Proper fluid balance and transformation
Associated_Symptoms: None specific

Description: Tongue appears dry, may have cracks, rough texture

Associated_Symptoms: Loose stools, edema, profuse thin discharge, cold limbs

Description: Tongue extends, retracts, and moves freely and normally

Description: Tongue habitually sticks out or protrudes

Associated_Symptoms: Varies: may have heat signs or be developmental

Description: Cannot fully protrude tongue

Clinical_Significance: Weakness or obstruction preventing extension
